definition: Wang Dao (276-339), powerful official of Jin dynasty and brother of general Wang Dun 王敦, regent of Jin from 325
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: Dear friends! We must immediately put an end to the journey, Director Wang also must say goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旅程马上要结束了，王导也要跟大家说再见了。

definition: Wang Dun (266-324), powerful general of Jin dynasty and brother of civil official Wang Dao 王導|王导, subsequently rebellious warlord 322-324
Liang Dynasty (502-557)
Jin Dynasty (265-420)
Sima Zhao (211-265), military general and statesman of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4]
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626

Zhangsun Wuji (c. 594-659), politician and historian of early Tang
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
Eastern Jin dynasty 317-420
Xun Yu (163-212), brilliant strategist, advisor of Cao Cao in Three Kingdoms
